cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west, forecast to bend WNW tonight and then NW on Friday, bringing the center toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near or just west of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA; Tropical-Storm Watch east of the Pearl River mouth to the MS/AL border and around Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm Warning from the mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Warning from the mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring brief tropical-storm-force gusts (39–45 mph) Friday night into Saturday; sustained gale conditions are unlikely (≤27% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground possible along Galveston Bay due to persistent onshore flow, but guidance keeps values below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches of intermittent heavy showers possible as outer bands rotate across SE Texas Friday–Saturday; localized ponding on port facilities possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and long-period swell could disrupt ship scheduling; dangerous rip currents along adjacent beaches.
